title: Optimal Algorithm with Complexity Separation for Strongly Convex-Strongly Concave Composite Saddle Point Problems
abstract:
In this work, we focuses on the following saddle point problem $\min_x \max_y p(x) + R(x,y) - q(y)$ where $R(x,y)$ is $L_R$-smooth, $μ_x$-strongly convex, $μ_y$-strongly concave and $p(x), q(y)$ are convex and $L_p, L_q$-smooth respectively. We present a new algorithm with optimal overall complexity $\mathcal{O}\left(\left(\sqrt{ rac{L_p}{μ_x}} +  rac{L_R}{\sqrt{μ_x μ_y}} + \sqrt{ rac{L_q}{μ_y}}ight)\log  rac{1}{\varepsilon}ight)$ and separation of oracle calls in the composite and saddle part. This algorithm requires $\mathcal{O}\left(\left(\sqrt{ rac{L_p}{μ_x}} + \sqrt{ rac{L_q}{μ_y}}ight) \log  rac{1}{\varepsilon}ight)$ oracle calls for $
abla p(x)$ and $
abla q(y)$ and $\mathcal{O} \left( \max\left\{\sqrt{ rac{L_p}{μ_x}}, \sqrt{ rac{L_q}{μ_y}},  rac{L_R}{\sqrt{μ_x μ_y}} ight\}\log  rac{1}{\varepsilon}ight)$ oracle calls for $
abla R(x,y)$ to find an $\varepsilon$-solution of the problem. To the best of our knowledge, we are the first to develop optimal algorithm with complexity separation in the case $μ_x 
ot = μ_y$. Also, we apply this algorithm to a bilinear saddle point problem and obtain the optimal complexity for this class of problems.
